intro: Cortusa sachalinensis, commonly known as the Sakhalin bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Far East of Russia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its striking blue to purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lanceolate and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branching. Cortusa sachalinensis is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in cooler climates.
